paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm actually going to sharesomething with you I haven't talked aboutprobably in more than 10 years. So bear with me as I take youthrough this journey.
paragraphs.en: 注意：我現在要和大家分享的 是一個我大約十多年來從來不談的故事 因此，請大家多多包涵 讓我帶著各位走完這一程

paragraphs.zh-tw: When I was 22 years old, I came home from work,put a leash on my dog and went for my usual run. I had no idea that at that moment, my life was going to change forever.
paragraphs.en: 我22歲的時候 有一天下了班回家，把狗繫上狗帶 如往常那樣出去跑步 我沒有想到那一刻 會從此改變了我的一生

paragraphs.zh-tw: While I was preparing my dog for the run, a man was finishing drinking at a bar, picked up his car keys, got into a car and headed south, or wherever he was. I was running across the street, and the only thingthat I actually remember is feeling like a grenadewent off in my head.
paragraphs.en: 我正在準備和我的狗一起跑步 有個男人喝了酒從酒吧出來 拿起他的車鑰匙上了車 然後往南開車 沒弄清楚他往哪兒 我當時跑過馬路 還能記得的是 覺得好似一顆手榴彈在我頭上炸開

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I rememberputting my hands on the ground and feeling my life's blood emptying out of my neck and my mouth. What had happened is, he ran a red light and hit me and my dog.
paragraphs.en: 我記得我的雙手撲地 感覺到我的生命之血 從我的脖子 我的口腔傾盆而出 發生的是 他闖紅燈撞到我和我的狗

paragraphs.zh-tw: She ended up underneath the car. I flew out in front of the car, and then he ran over my legs.
paragraphs.en: 我的狗被壓在車下 我在車前飛了出去 然後他碾過了我的雙腿

paragraphs.zh-tw: My left leg got caught upin the wheel well -- spun it around. The bumper of the car hit my throat, slicing it open.
paragraphs.en: 我的左腿給輪邊纏上了 順著車輪捲了起來 保險桿打中我的喉嚨 喉嚨給削開了

paragraphs.zh-tw: I ended up with blunt chest trauma. Your aorta comes up behind your heart,it's your major artery -- and it was severed, so my bloodwas gurgling out of my mouth.
paragraphs.en: 結果是我受到胸部鈍傷 大動脈跑到心臟後面 那是主動脈卻割斷了 血液從我的口腔咕嚕嚕流出 化成血泡

paragraphs.zh-tw: It foamed, and ... horrible thingswere happening to me. I had no idea what was going on, but strangers intervened, kept my heart moving, beating.
paragraphs.en: 還有些可怕的事發生在我身上 我完全不知道發生了什麼事 但有些陌生人介入 讓我的心臟保持運動、跳動，我說運動

paragraphs.zh-tw: I say "moving," because it was quivering, and they were trying to puta beat back into it. Somebody was smartand put a Bic pen in my neck to open up my airway,so I could get some air in there.
paragraphs.en: 因為它只在微微顫動 他們嘗試恢復我的心跳 有個人很聰明，用一支筆管插入我的脖子 通開呼吸道，讓我還能吸進一點空氣 我的肺也垮了

paragraphs.zh-tw: And my lung collapsed, so somebody cut me openand put a pen in there as well, to stop that catastrophicevent from happening. Somehow I ended up at the hospital.
paragraphs.en: 有人幫我切開，放了些別針進去支撐 以免造成嚴重災難 不知怎的，我已經躺在醫院裡

paragraphs.zh-tw: I was wrapped in ice, and then eventually putinto a drug-induced coma. Eighteen months later, I woke up.
paragraphs.en: 全身被包著冰水 然後被送進藥物誘導的昏迷狀態 18個月後我醒來

paragraphs.zh-tw: I was blind, I couldn't speak and I couldn't walk. I was 64 pounds.
paragraphs.en: 眼睛看不見，話也不能說 我無法走路 瘦到只剩29公斤

paragraphs.zh-tw: The hospital really has no ideawhat to do with people like that. And in fact, they startedto call me a "gomer." That's another storywe won't even get into.
paragraphs.en: 醫院也真的不知道 該如何處理我這樣的人 事實上，他們開始叫我「歌篾」(活死人)了 那是另外的故事，我們在這裡不談

paragraphs.zh-tw: I had so many surgeriesto put my neck back together, to repair my heart a few times. Some things worked, some things didn't.
paragraphs.en: 我動了無數手術才抖正我的脖子 心臟也矯治了好幾次 有些功能正常，有些不正常 我身上放了不少鈦合金

paragraphs.zh-tw: I had lots of titanium put in me; cadaver bones, to try to get my feetmoving the right way. And I ended up with a plastic nose, porcelain teethand all kinds of other things.
paragraphs.en: 還有大體捐贈的骨骼 好讓我的腿能正確移動 結果鼻子是塑料，牙齒是搪瓷做的 還裝了許多其它東西

paragraphs.zh-tw: But eventually,I started to look human again. But ...
paragraphs.en: 不過，我開始像個人樣

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's hard sometimesto talk about these things, so bear with me. I had more than 50 surgeries.
paragraphs.en: 再談這些往事，真是令人難過 因此，請大家多多包涵 我動過50多次手術

paragraphs.zh-tw: But who's counting? So eventually, the hospital decidedit was time for me to go. They needed to open upspace for somebody else that they thought could come back from whatever they were going through.
paragraphs.en: 但是，誰還去算幾次？ 醫院終於做了決定 該是要我出院的時候了 他們得騰出病床給別人 給無論遭遇了什麼 他們還認為有救的人

paragraphs.zh-tw: Everybody lost faith in mebeing able to recover. So they basically put a mapup on the wall, threw a dart, and it landed at a senior home,here in Colorado.
paragraphs.en: 人人對我的康復都沒了信心 基本上，他們像是在牆上掛了地圖，擲飛鏢決定 結果我就進了一家科羅拉多州的老人院

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I know all of youare scratching your head: "A senior citizens' home? What in the worldare you going to do there?" But if you think aboutall of the skills and talent that are in this room right now, that's what a senior home has. So there were all these skills and talents that these seniors had.
paragraphs.en: 我知道你們都在搔腦袋： 「送到老人院？你到哪兒幹嘛？」 但是，各位想一想 今天在這房間裡所有的技能和才智 都是老人院裡所擁有的 所有這些技能和才智 那些那些老人都有

paragraphs.zh-tw: The one advantagethey had over most of you is wisdom, because they had a long life. And I needed that wisdomat that moment in my life.
paragraphs.en: 其中他們勝過各位大多數的一個長處 就是智慧 因為他們的人生閱歷長 我那時所需的正是那樣的智慧

paragraphs.zh-tw: But imagine what it was like for them when I showed up at their doorstep. At that point, I had gainedfour pounds, so I was 68 pounds.
paragraphs.en: 各位可以想像當時 我出現在他們門前，對他們而言會是怎樣的情況 那時我胖回了1.8公斤 那就是將近31公斤

paragraphs.zh-tw: I was bald. I was wearing hospital scrubs.
paragraphs.en: 光頭 身穿著醫院的寒酸院服

paragraphs.zh-tw: And somebody donated tennis shoes for me. And I had a white cane in one hand and a suitcase full of medicalrecords in another hand.
paragraphs.en: 腳穿著人家送的網球鞋 一手持著白色盲人杖 另一手提著滿箱的醫療記錄

paragraphs.zh-tw: So the senior citizens realized that they needed to havean emergency meeting. So they pulled backand they were looking at each other, and they were going, "OK,what skills do we have in this room? This kid needs a lot of work." So they eventually startedmatching their talents and skills to all of my needs.
paragraphs.en: 因此，所有的老人們都知道 他們需要召開一次緊急會議 他們往後退了一下，對望了一會 接著說「好啦，我們這房子裡有什麼辦法？ 這孩子有好多要弄。」 他們最後開始 搭配起他們的才智和技能 為我提供所需的一切

paragraphs.zh-tw: But one of the first thingsthey needed to do was assess what I needed right away. I needed to figure out how to eatlike a normal human being, since I'd been eatingthrough a tube in my chest and through my veins.
paragraphs.en: 可是，他們首先要做的是 確定我立即需要的是什麼 我當時得學會 像正常人那樣進食 因為我一直是用一根穿過胸部的管子 通過靜脈進食的

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I had to gothrough trying to eat again. And they went through that process.
paragraphs.en: 因此， 我得再重新學習如何進食 他們帶著我走過那整個過程

paragraphs.zh-tw: And then they had to figure out: "Well, she needs furniture. She is sleeping in the cornerof this apartment." So they went to their storage lockers and all gathered their extra furniture -- gave me pots and pans, blankets -- everything.
paragraphs.en: 然後他們也發現： 「啊，她需要家具 她現在睡的是公寓的角落。」 他們跑到儲物箱 把多餘的家具湊在一起 給我水壺、鍋子、毛氈的 所有東西

paragraphs.zh-tw: And then the next thing that I needed was a makeover. So out went the green scrubs, and in came the polyesterand floral prints.
paragraphs.en: 接下來，我需要的是 添添妝，改改外型 寒酸的綠色院服扔掉 穿上化學纖維造的花衣

paragraphs.zh-tw: We're not going to talkabout the hairstyles they tried to force on meonce my hair grew back. But I did say no to the blue hair.
paragraphs.en: 我還沒說我頭髮長回來時，他們想強迫我 做的髮型，但是我 確實反對了把頭髮弄成藍色

paragraphs.zh-tw: So eventually, what went on is, they decided that, well,I need to learn to speak. You can't be an independent person if you're not able to speakand you can't see.
paragraphs.en: 事情還沒完，他們還決定 我得重新學會說話 如果不能說話、不能看見 那就無法獨立生活

paragraphs.zh-tw: So they figured not being ableto see is one thing, but they need to get me to talk. So while Sally, the office manager, was teaching me to speak in the day -- it's hard, because when you're a kid,you take things for granted.
paragraphs.en: 他們發現要我讓能看見是一回事 但他們得先讓我能說話 所以，辦事處主管莎莉 白天教我說話 那可真困難，因為 小時候，樣樣來得自然

paragraphs.zh-tw: You learn things unconsciously. But for me, I was an adultand it was embarrassing, and I had to learn how to coordinatemy new throat with my tongue and my new teeth and my lips, and capture the air and get the word out.
paragraphs.en: 不知覺中就學會了 但是我當時已是成人，那有多難堪 我還得學習如何協調 新的嗓門和舌頭 新的牙齒和嘴唇 學習吸進氣來吐出話

paragraphs.zh-tw: So, I acted like a two-year-old, and refused to work. But the men had a better idea.
paragraphs.en: 所以我就像兩歲小孩那樣 拒絕服從 但那些人有更好的主意

paragraphs.zh-tw: They were going to make it fun for me. So they were teaching mecuss-word Scrabble at night.
paragraphs.en: 他們為了讓我得到樂趣 晚上就教我來「牙言齦語」的拼說遊戲

paragraphs.zh-tw: And then, secretly,how to swear like a sailor. I'm going to just leave itto your imagination as to what my first words were -- when Sally finally gotmy confidence built.
paragraphs.en: 然後又偷偷 教我如何像水手那樣罵人 這裡，我準備讓各位想像一下 當莎莉終於重建了我的自信後 我首先說出來的是哪些話語

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I moved on from there. And a former teacherwho happened to have Alzheimer's took on the task of teaching me to write.
paragraphs.en: 我就從那裡繼續前進 有一位以前當老師的，他罹患了阿茲海默 擔任教我寫字，這項多餘的學習

paragraphs.zh-tw: The redundancy was actually good for me. So, we'll just keep moving on.
paragraphs.en: 事實上對我幫助不小 我們繼續向進

paragraphs.zh-tw: One of the pivotal times for me was actually learningto cross the street again as a blind person. So close your eyes.
paragraphs.en: 其中有一個轉捩點 就是讓我以一個盲人的身份 重新學會過馬路 請閉上眼睛，想像一下

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now imagine you have to cross a street. You don't know how far that street is, and you don't knowif you're going straight.
paragraphs.en: 必須那樣過馬路的情況 你不知道馬路有多寬 你也不曉得能否筆直橫過

paragraphs.zh-tw: And you hear cars whizzing back and forth, and you had a horrible accident that landed you in this situation. So there were two obstaclesI had to get through.
paragraphs.en: 你聽到那些車聲颼颼來往 你還有過恐怖的意外 讓你落得這步田地 因此，我有兩個難關必須熬過

paragraphs.zh-tw: One was post-traumatic stress disorder. Every time I approachedthe corner or the curb, I would panic.
paragraphs.en: 一是嚴重創傷的後遺症 每次走近街角或是路肩 我會恐慌

paragraphs.zh-tw: And the second one was actually trying to figure outhow to cross that street. So one of the seniors just came up to me, and she pushed meup to the corner and said, "When you think it's time to go,just stick the cane out there.
paragraphs.en: 再是 真正嘗試要怎麼橫過馬路 有位老人跑上前來 她把我推到街角上，說： 「你覺得可以跨出去的時候，把盲人杖伸出去

paragraphs.zh-tw: If it's hit, don't cross the street." Made perfect sense. But by the third canethat went whizzing across the road -- they realized that they neededto put their resources together, and they raised funds so that I could goto the Braille Institute and actually gain the skillsto be a blind person, and also to go get a guide dog, who transformed my life.
paragraphs.en: 要是被撞啦，不要過馬路。」 說得有道理 不過，用到第三根盲人杖時 拐杖颼地飛過了馬路 這下他們明白了要集中資源 於是他們集資 讓我進了布萊葉學院 在那兒學得了 盲人的技能 也還取得了一隻導盲犬 牠改變了我的生命

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I was able to return to college because of the senior citizenswho invested in me, and also the guide dogand skill set I had gained. Ten years later, I gained my sight back.
paragraphs.en: 後來我能回到大學上課 都是由於這些老人對我的投資 以及那隻導盲犬和我所獲得的那些技能 10年後，我重見光明

paragraphs.zh-tw: Not magically -- I opted in for three surgeries, and one of them was experimental. It was actually robotic surgery that removed a hematomafrom behind my eye.
paragraphs.en: 不是奇蹟 我同意動了三個手術 其中一個是實驗性質的 實際上是機控手術 他們從我的眼後取出血腫

paragraphs.zh-tw: The biggest change for mewas that the world moved forward, that there were innovationsand all kinds of new things -- cellphones, laptops, all these thingsthat I had never seen before. And as a blind person, your visual memory fades, and is replaced with how youfeel about things and how things sound and how things smell.
paragraphs.en: 對我而言 變化最大是整個世界往前進 科技創新 種種新的事物 手機、筆記型電腦 這些東西都是我以前沒見過的 作為盲人的時候 你的視覺記憶會減退 會被你對物件的感覺所取代 物件會發出什麼聲音 物件有什麼氣味

paragraphs.zh-tw: So one day, I was in my room and I saw this thing sitting in my room. I thought it was a monster, so I was walking around it.
paragraphs.en: 有一天，我在房間裡 我看到這麼一個東西 我以為是一頭怪物 我繞著它走

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I go, "I'm just going to touch it." And I touched it and I went, "Oh my God, it's a laundry basket." Everything is differentwhen you're a sighted person, because you take that for granted. But when you're blind,you have the tactile memory for things.
paragraphs.en: 我想：我要摸摸它是什麼 我摸了它，恍然大悟 「天吶，那是個洗衣籃。」 如果你看得見的話 所有東西都不一樣 因為你認為理所當然 但如果你是盲眼的 你對東西的記憶是觸覺的

paragraphs.zh-tw: The biggest change for mewas looking down at my hands and seeing that I'd lost10 years of my life. I thought that timehad stood still for some reason and moved on for family and friends.
paragraphs.en: 我最大的改變是看著我的雙手 看到我的生命失去了10年 我想，出於某種緣故，時間靜止了 對家人和朋友們而言，時間流逝

paragraphs.zh-tw: But when I looked down, I realized that timemarched on for me, too, and that I needed to get caught up. So I got going on it.
paragraphs.en: 但當我看下去 我明白了，時間也從我身上流逝 我必須追趕 我得抓住它

paragraphs.zh-tw: We didn't have words like "crowdsourcing"and "radical collaboration" when I had my accident. But the concept held true -- people working with people to rebuild me; people working with peopleto reeducate me.
paragraphs.en: 我發生意外時，並沒有「群眾幫忙」和 「徹底協作」這些詞眼 但概念是真實存在的 人們協力讓我重生 人們協力讓我重建

paragraphs.zh-tw: I wouldn't be standing here today if it wasn't for extremeradical collaboration. Thank you so much.
paragraphs.en: 我今天不可能站在這裡 若非真有最大程度的「徹底協作」存在的話 非常感謝 (鼓掌)

title: Ramona Pierson An Unexpected Place Of Healing
